Private Litigation Case Title: ROCHLIN et al v. CINCINNATI INSURANCE COMPANY

Description: Cincinnati Life agreed to pay more than $200,000 to a group of states to resolve allegations of racially discriminatory practices.
$5,000 fine levied for issuing 485 policies that provided a risk mitigation benefit exceeding the limit.
Agency: Washington State Office of the Insurance Commissioner

Description: Cincinnati Life agreed to pay up to $1.9 million to resolve litigation alleging racially discriminatory practices by Inter-Ocean Insurance Company, which it acquired in 1973.
Court: Butler County (OH) Court of Common Pleas
Private Litigation Case Title: Cone v. Cincinnati Life Insurance Company
